channel.title: Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Final Report
item.description: Welcome to our journey to Open IoT Challenge by Eclipse! Last December our proposal was chosen from 70 proposal to participate. Also we’ve got a promocode for electronics and started to work.

item.title: ModeS3 - DDS and Xtext
item.description: Code generation from state machines to DDS execution environment.

item.title: Alya - Cloud voice recognition Alexa for alya-smart-mirror
item.description: Alya can be integrated with Alexa using all the great built in capabilities of Alexa.

item.title: Alya - asm-app: a react native mobile app to configure alya-smart-mirror
item.description: Let’s introduce our react native app “asm app” which is one of the main alya core component. Our app plays a major role in our project as it’s an intermediary between the end user and the backend as discussed before in “asm-backend” .

item.title: ModeS3 - Our choice of DDS implementation: Vortex OpenSplice DDS
item.description: After we had decided to use DDS for the communication between the components of our distributed system that we would like to manage, we had to choose the implementation of this middleware.

item.title: Trusted IoT - Testing: Four, five, six
item.description: We commented on Testing: One, two, three, that we would like to develop a software tool which would allow anyone to fine-tune his/her installation to a position as accurately as possible. This tool is ready and available in mide repository.

item.title: Trync - How we connect Eclipse Kura gateway to a web application hosted on WildFly
item.description: As we are using RaspberryPI hardware running Eclipse Kura on top of Raspbian OS as Trync gateway we have to connect it to the Trync Dashboad, a web application developed with Java hosted on WildFly application server.

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Build Scheme and components
item.description: You need a number of components to assemble Cloud Oscilloscope. Most of them can be bought at the nearest radio store or on AliExpress.

item.title: Alya - Cloud-based Face Recognition for Alya Smart Mirror
item.description: Alongside with the voice recognition support, Alya supports personalization through face recognition, in this article we will go through cloud-based face recognition in Alya.

item.title: Alya - Offline voice recognition for “alya-smart-mirror
item.description: Having a voice recognition support in ASM is part of the core services which is used to recognize the voice commands given by the user. We selected an offline voice recognition service since it is less expensive and requires less configurations.

item.title: ModeS3 - SmartCity Intro
item.description: MoDeS3 – Smart City project integrates these innovative solutions into a common framework and testbed.

item.title: ActivIoTy - Checkpoints on the Move?
item.description: We are on the last mile of the challenge, and I’m exploring new ways to enrich the user experience of the platform, adding new features.

item.title: Trusted IoT - Parallelizing IOTA transactions in Kura
item.description: What’s the fuss about? From now on, Jura is scalable in terms of locations stored in the tangle. How? Using IOTA’s workers.

item.title: Autonomy of Things - Location Awareness in IoT with Beacon Technology
item.description: In this article I’ll share the findings of my feasibility tests for implementing a location service with Bluetooth beacon using iOS and Linux-powered devices.

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Backend Architecture
item.description: We’re working on a backend for our Cloud Oscilloscope project. On the last meetings we decided to use common technologies for IoT to connect our device with backend.
